Draw a User Journey diagram for 'Preparing a Presentation'. Title: 'Presentation Prep'. Sections: 'Planning & Research', 'Content Creation', 'Design', 'Practice'. Planning & Research: 'Define Objective & Audience' (score 5, actor: Presenter), 'Gather Information & Data' (score 6, actor: Presenter), 'Outline Key Points' (score 4, actor: Presenter). Content Creation: 'Write Script/Talking Points' (score 7, actor: Presenter), 'Develop Core Content for Slides' (score 6, actor: Presenter). Design: 'Choose Presentation Template' (score 3, actor: Presenter), 'Create/Format Slides' (score 5, actor: Presenter), 'Add Visuals (Images, Charts)' (score 4, actor: Presenter). Practice: 'Rehearse Delivery & Timing' (score 8, actor: Presenter), 'Get Feedback (Optional)' (score 5, actors: Presenter, Colleague), 'Finalize Slides & Notes' (score 3, actor: Presenter).

journey
    title Presentation Prep
    section Planning & Research
      Define Objective & Audience: 5: Presenter
      Gather Information & Data: 6: Presenter
      Outline Key Points: 4: Presenter
    section Content Creation
      Write Script/Talking Points: 7: Presenter
      Develop Core Content for Slides: 6: Presenter
    section Design
      Choose Presentation Template: 3: Presenter
      Create/Format Slides: 5: Presenter
      Add Visuals (Images, Charts): 4: Presenter
    section Practice
      Rehearse Delivery & Timing: 8: Presenter
      Get Feedback (Optional): 5: Presenter, Colleague
      Finalize Slides & Notes: 3: Presenter

Construct a diagram with multiple services within nested groups connected via junctions: Group `region` (cloud)[Region] contains Group `vpc` (cloud)[VPC]. Group `vpc` contains Group `subnet_a` (cloud)[SubnetA] and Group `subnet_b` (cloud)[SubnetB]. `subnet_a` contains `service_a1` (server)[A1] and `service_a2` (server)[A2]. `subnet_b` contains `service_b1` (database)[B1]. Junction `j_a` is in `subnet_a`. Junction `j_b` is in `subnet_b`. Connect `service_a1`:R to `j_a`:L. Connect `service_a2`:B to `j_a`:T. Connect `j_a`:R to `j_b`:L (`-->`). Connect `j_b`:R to `service_b1`:L (`-->`).

architecture-beta
    group region(cloud)[Region]
    group vpc(cloud)[VPC] in region
    group subnet_a(cloud)[SubnetA] in vpc
    group subnet_b(cloud)[SubnetB] in vpc

    service service_a1(server)[A1] in subnet_a
    service service_a2(server)[A2] in subnet_a
    service service_b1(database)[B1] in subnet_b

    junction j_a in subnet_a
    junction j_b in subnet_b

    service_a1:R -- L:j_a
    service_a2:B -- T:j_a
    j_a:R --> L:j_b
    j_b:R --> L:service_b1

Create a C4Context diagram with a title 'IoT System Context'. Include a Person 'User' (user), a System 'MobileApp' (app), a System 'CloudPlatform' (cloud), and an external System_Ext 'DeviceHardware' (device). Add relationships: 'User' interacts with 'MobileApp' ('Controls Device'). 'MobileApp' sends commands to 'CloudPlatform' ('Sends Commands', 'MQTT'). 'CloudPlatform' communicates with 'DeviceHardware' ('Controls Hardware', 'Proprietary Protocol'). 'DeviceHardware' sends data back to 'CloudPlatform' ('Sends Telemetry', 'MQTT').

C4Context
  title IoT System Context

  Person(user, "User", "The end-user interacting with the system")
  System(app, "MobileApp", "Allows user to monitor and control the device")
  System(cloud, "CloudPlatform", "Receives commands, manages devices, and processes telemetry")
  System_Ext(device, "DeviceHardware", "The physical IoT device sending data and receiving commands")

  Rel(user, app, "Controls Device")
  Rel(app, cloud, "Sends Commands", "MQTT")
  Rel(cloud, device, "Controls Hardware", "Proprietary Protocol")
  Rel(device, cloud, "Sends Telemetry", "MQTT")

  UpdateRelStyle(user, app, $offsetY="-20")
  UpdateRelStyle(app, cloud, $offsetY="-20", $offsetX="10")
  UpdateRelStyle(cloud, device, $offsetY="-20")
  UpdateRelStyle(device, cloud, $offsetY="20", $offsetX="-10")

Draw microservices: Group `order_processing` (cloud, "Order Processing") contains `order_service` (server, "Order Svc") (`in order_processing`). Group `inventory_management` (cloud, "Inventory") contains `inventory_service` (server, "Inventory Svc") (`in inventory_management`). Group `shipping_logistics` (cloud, "Shipping") contains `shipping_service` (server, "Shipping Svc") (`in shipping_logistics`). `message_broker` (database, "Message Broker") outside groups. Connect `order_service`:B <-- `T:inventory_service`.

    group inventory_management(cloud)[Inventory]
    group shipping_logistics(cloud)[Shipping]

    service inventory_service(server)[Inventory Svc] in inventory_management
    service shipping_service(server)[Shipping Svc] in shipping_logistics

    service message_broker(database)[Message Broker]

    order_service:R --> L:message_broker
    message_broker:R --> L:inventory_service
    message_broker:B --> T:shipping_service
    inventory_service:T --> B:order_service

Construct a C4Component diagram with multiple components interacting. Title 'Complex Component Interaction'. Define `Container_Boundary` (service, 'Main Service') containing: `Component` (a, 'A'), `Component` (b, 'B'), `Component` (c, 'C'), `Component` (d, 'D'), `ComponentDb` (db_e, 'E'), `ComponentQueue` (q_f, 'F'). Show `a` -> `b` ('Uses'). `b` -> `c` ('Calls'). `c` -> `db_e` ('Writes to'). `a` -> `d` ('Notifies'). `d` -> `q_f` ('Sends message to').

C4Component
  title Complex Component Interaction

  Container_Boundary(service, "Main Service") {
    Component(a, "A")
    Component(b, "B")
    Component(c, "C")
    Component(d, "D")
    ComponentDb(db_e, "E")
    ComponentQueue(q_f, "F")

    Rel(a, b, "Uses")
    Rel(b, c, "Calls")
    Rel(c, db_e, "Writes to")
    Rel(a, d, "Notifies")
    Rel(d, q_f, "Sends message to")
  }

  UpdateRelStyle(a, b, $offsetY="-10")
  UpdateRelStyle(b, c, $offsetY="-10")
  UpdateRelStyle(c, db_e, $offsetY="-10")
  UpdateRelStyle(a, d, $offsetY="10")
  UpdateRelStyle(d, q_f, $offsetY="10")

  merge task id: "Merge Task"
